reference.title: erf, erff, erfc, erfcf : error function

section.title: Synopsis
Description
section.p: erf calculates an approximation to the "error function", which estimates the probability that an observation will fall within x standard deviations of the mean (assuming a normal distribution). erfc calculates the complementary probability; that is, erfc(x) is 1 - erf(x). erfc is computed directly, so that you can use it to avoid the loss of precision that would result from subtracting large probabilities (on large x) from 1. erff and erfcf differ from erf and erfc only in the argument and result types.

section.title: Returns
section.p: For positive arguments, erf and all its variants return a probability--a number between 0 and 1.
